critique: This executive order concerns the revocation of a previous order withdrawing certain lands in California and Nevada, and the subsequent opening of these lands for homesteading, primarily to ex-service men. It doesn't directly address ideological issues, immigration, executive power in a broad sense, or national security. It touches on federalism insofar as it manages federal lands, and economic regulation by opening land for private use. It also has a slight social inclusion aspect by prioritizing ex-service men.
